channel.title: Dubstep Community Achieved
channel.description:
I'VE FINISHED THE DUBSTEP COMMUNITY.
I have a main blog page for home and a forum set up so far. This is for everyone who wanted me to finish the dubstep community.
If you want an invite or the url, just PM me. I would rather not advertise here ;)
[quote="The Reaper X"]HELLO MOPARSCAPE.
Recently I've become incredibly indulged in dubstep and I've been thinking about creating a community and website revolving around the genre. I've been looking for similar sites and I have yet to find one that supplies what I plan on bringing to the "dubstep community" scene.
Don't worry, I don't plan on becoming a complete ass and infecting the moparscape lifestyle with dubstep in the GD, although I know that's nearly all I post now. However, I do need some advice on some ideas and for you guys to give the go-- or rather tell me if you would be interested in actually registering at such a website.
[size=12pt][b]MY DEVIOUS PLANS[/b][/size]
[ul][li]Audio Sharing (I know bandwith cost is going to fucking blow)[/li] [li]Downloadable synth and bass patches (.ksd)[/li] [li]Artist Showcasing [size=8pt][i]- highlighting popular dubstep along with new dubstep artists[/i][/size][/li] [li]Venue Alerts and Forecasting [size=8pt][i]- providing information as to where shows may be[/i][/size][/li] [li]Dubstep forum along with threaded and video tutorials.[/li] [li]And the obvious networking features[/li][/ul]
If there's anything that you'd like to see in what I'm planning on doing, let me know. This is not a runescape emulation, this is something original and it revolves around what I love doing-- SO THIS WILL BE FINISHED NO MATTER HOW LONG IT TAKES.
Feedback, suggestions, do the poll, etc. Thanks boys. [size=1pt]girls don't go on internets[/size][/quote]

item.title: Dubstep Community Achieved

item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

I’VE FINISHED THE DUBSTEP COMMUNITY.

I have a main blog page for home and a forum set up so far. This is for everyone who wanted me to finish the dubstep community.

If you want an invite or the url, just PM me. I would rather not advertise here

[quote=“The Reaper X, post:1, topic:387616”]HELLO MOPARSCAPE.

Recently I’ve become incredibly indulged in dubstep and I’ve been thinking about creating a community and website revolving around the genre. I’ve been looking for similar sites and I have yet to find one that supplies what I plan on bringing to the “dubstep community” scene.

Don’t worry, I don’t plan on becoming a complete ass and infecting the moparscape lifestyle with dubstep in the GD, although I know that’s nearly all I post now. However, I do need some advice on some ideas and for you guys to give the go-- or rather tell me if you would be interested in actually registering at such a website.

[size=12pt]MY DEVIOUS PLANS[/size]

[ul][li]Audio Sharing (I know bandwith cost is going to fucking blow)[/li]
[li]Downloadable synth and bass patches (.ksd)[/li]
[li]Artist Showcasing [size=8pt]- highlighting popular dubstep along with new dubstep artists[/size][/li]
[li]Venue Alerts and Forecasting [size=8pt]- providing information as to where shows may be[/size][/li]
[li]Dubstep forum along with threaded and video tutorials.[/li]
[li]And the obvious networking features[/li][/ul]

If there’s anything that you’d like to see in what I’m planning on doing, let me know. This is not a runescape emulation, this is something original and it revolves around what I love doing-- SO THIS WILL BE FINISHED NO MATTER HOW LONG IT TAKES.

Feedback, suggestions, do the poll, etc. Thanks boys. [size=1pt]girls don’t go on internets[/size][/quote]

item.title: Dubstep Community Achieved
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

If you plan on sharing music, just use Newgrounds. I think the file limit is 15mb now. We can listen to it whenever we want, others can listen to and review it, and we can download it if we so please.

Read full topic

item.title: Dubstep Community Achieved
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

[quote=“Slave Scyth, post:10, topic:387616”]I’m against any form of ‘subscription service’; free is where it’s at. Don’t go beyond ads for REQUIRING service.

By requiring, I mean let EVERYBODY at least have the basic functionality. Hell, do similar to what Pandora does: if people pay, allow them to download higher quality music (192 kbps vs 128 kbps).

I, at least, ALWAYS avoid sites that require you to pay to continue using them.

Otherwise, and it’s not like you’ve said, or I’ve seen at least, you say anything about specifics on making money, it’s a great idea.[/quote]

This unless it is extremely necessary. I can’t see myself being charged to use this site though.

It’s not my type of music but it would definitely be interesting to create. I’d probably join to see how it develops and maybe experiment with it a bit. Definitely go with the drum and bass idea as well.

Read full topic

item.title: Dubstep Community Achieved
item.dc:creator: @Slave_Scyth Slave Scyth
item.description:
@Slave_Scyth wrote:

I’m against any form of ‘subscription service’; free is where it’s at. Don’t go beyond ads for REQUIRING service.

By requiring, I mean let EVERYBODY at least have the basic functionality. Hell, do similar to what Pandora does: if people pay, allow them to download higher quality music (192 kbps vs 128 kbps).

I, at least, ALWAYS avoid sites that require you to pay to continue using them.

Otherwise, and it’s not like you’ve said, or I’ve seen at least, you say anything about specifics on making money, it’s a great idea.

Read full topic

item.title: Dubstep Community Achieved
item.dc:creator: @k0_twin k0 twin
item.description:
@k0_twin wrote:

Fuck yeah I would join.

Read full topic

item.title: Dubstep Community Achieved
item.dc:creator: @Lord_Typhis Lord Typhis
item.description:
@Lord_Typhis wrote:

I truly; LOVE Dubstep. I think it sounds like a great idea, but, of course if you wanted to make money off this site; sure, let the first newcoming people download some free songs (lets say 10 songs for free), after they have downloaded allthe free songs, create a ‘Premium Status’ sort-of thing, put come up with a catchy name for it, something that involves what you are doing, (dubstep, or if you wanted to move onto different styles of music), and charge $5.99 (monthly) for lets say; 50 songs they can download a month. As currently dubstep is becoming more and more popular.

You’ll make a fortune.

Read full topic

item.title: Dubstep Community Achieved
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

Yeah, I’ve looked around and there is no community based on dubstep other than dubstepforum.com, which is solely a forum. Initially my plan is to provoke interaction between other dubstep artists. The scene of dubstep right now is growing incredibly fast and it’s perfect timing to start something.

But yeah, I’ll think about Including drum and bass, as that is partially what dubstep was derived from anyways.

Read full topic

item.title: Dubstep Community Achieved
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Steve Epic Steve
item.description:
@Epic_Steve wrote:

I wouldn’t join, as I can’t stand Dubstep, but it’s a good idea.

I also have to agree with Rash, this does have the potential to become quite big, although, only if there are no other major Dubstep websites. Unless ofcourse, you have a plan to compete with them.

Read full topic

item.title: Dubstep Community Achieved
item.dc:creator: @rash Rash
item.description:
@rash wrote:

[quote=“Primadude, post:3, topic:387616”][quote author=Rash link=topic=483412.msg3541149#msg3541149 date=1300866134]
If what you say about there being no real ubstep sites, you could make thousands off this.
[/quote]

There’s only a dubstep forum, and that’s about it.

@Reaper: Make it both Dubstep and Drum & Bass. The two crossed together (Drumstep) are fucking awesome, but yet again the two singular are awesome still ;).[/quote]

Well, this has the potentiall to be big, if done properly.

Read full topic
